page.title: 06Fletton land reclamation 2
page.content: The pit filling process continues for 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Two 48 wagon trains, arrive each day at regular intervals and the ash is removed from 24 wagons simultaneously by pumping compressed air into each of the wagons. The ash first floats and then begins to flow out of the wagons, when it is then mixed with water to form a {slurry }which is then pumped along a network of pipes and into the pit which has been selected for filling. As the ash settles, the surface water is drained off by using a weir system, and the water is then pumped back into the main reservoir, itself preeviously a pit, to be used again and again. When the level of ash has reached the required limits, a final layer of 150 mm of topsoil is added in order to attempt to return the land to its original state.
